title: Added a changelog
body: From now on, PRs should add an entry to the changelog if relevant.

title: Update crossbeam to 0.3
body: Especially to pick up https://github.com/crossbeam-rs/crossbeam/pull/147

title: Fix the StdDescriptorPool being destroyed too often
body: Same fix as #801 but for descriptor pools.

title: Improvements for the StandardCommandPool
body: Right now a new command pool is created every time you create a command buffer. Ouch. That's due to a bug fixed in this PR.

title: Correctly take image mipmaps into account
Fixes blitting validation
body:
Some extra fixes to blitting:
- Fixes image layout check on source, this was checking for TransferDstOptimal instead of TransferSrcOptimal.
- Fixes bottom_right dimensions check, this should be 1 instead of 0 on dimensions beyond the ones applicable to the image.
- Fixes incorrect array_layers bounds check, which needed to be `>` rather than `>=`.

Added on request:
- Fixes format type validation

title: Fixes check_blit_image
body: Fixes inverted checks and a check on the wrong structure in `check_blit_image`. (Fixes #791)

title: Pass a Limits struct to check_desc_against_limits
body: Not a breaking change as the function is not actually accessible from the outside world.

title: Implement `device::QueuesIter::device(&self)`.
body:
This way people can get access to the device without first popping a queue from the iterator. 

To me it seems silly now that `Device::new` returns a device and a `QueuesIter`, even though the former is easily accessible through the latter. This might be a point of future refactoring?

title: Check the descriptor sets compatibility when drawing
body: Probably a major source of stupid mistakes, finally fixed.

title: Make the Layout generated by vulkano-shaders entirely public
body:
Allows building your own `Layout`.
Unfortunately not very documented, but well...

title: Extract the Limits struct in its own module
Remove the guide examples
body:
cc https://github.com/vulkano-rs/vulkano-www/commit/e312fef9de38167eadb66a10342b8ac43e435c35
cc #772

title: Add a test for specialization constants in a compute pipeline
Add the logo to the README
body:
Close #717 

cc @HansEberhart
So you agree that your logo is under Apache2/MIT, or whatever compatible license you want?

title: Continue cleanup of the graphics pipeline builder code
Fix `ApplicationInfo::from_cargo_toml`
body:
This pull request fixes #500.

Until now, `from_cargo_toml` always filled the `ApplicationInfo` structure with the name and version of the `vulkano` crate, instead of the calling crate.

To fix this, `from_cargo_toml` is now a macro, which becomes an expression which gathers the required environment variables. It is meant to be invoked when the user's crate is built, not when `vulkano` is built.

title: Reflect specialization constants in vulkano-shaders
body:
`vulkano-shaders` now generates a `SpecializationConstants` struct for each shader module, that implements the `SpecializationConstants` trait of vulkano. Also implements `Default` for when you want to use the defaults that were specified in the SPIR-V code.

If a shader module doesn't contain any spec const the specialization constants will be `()` instead, because of backward compatibility.

This makes specialization constants usable for compute pipelines, but not for graphics pipelines yet because they are not implemented in vulkano itself yet.

title: More limits check fixes
body: Actually we want to ignore the situation where the trait returns `None`, as it is perfectly valid to have empty sets.

title: Use a lock-free queue in the FixedSizeDescriptorSetsPool
Add more badges to README
body:
This commit adds more badges to the repo's README file:

- a badge for `vulkano` on `crates.io`.
- a badge for CI build status.
- the docs.rs badge has been moved to the top, next to the other badges.

title: Remove some unused variables and functions
body: I removed [these two lines](https://github.com/vulkano-rs/vulkano/blob/2f2b97e5d5ecfa934fb3be3bb8fe131a4e2bce95/vulkano/src/lib.rs#L61-L62) and fixed some warnings.

title: Fix num sets
body: Fix #762

title: Fix #760
body: Fix #760

title: Check pipeline layout limits
body: Fix #585

title: Prevent creating a new swapchain from a stale one
body:
This pull request prevents creating a swapchain from an old one, if the old one has already been used to recreate another one.

It does so by checking the `swapchain.stale` property, and sets it correctly. Also added a new `SwapchainCreationError::OldSwapchainAlreadyUsed` error to report this situation.

Fixes #735.

title: Improve swapchain docs
body: This pull request adds more example code to the documentation for the swapchain module.

title: Add a link to the README in the Cargo.toml
Add Surface::new()
body:
Creates a `Surface` given the raw handler

This is needed for me, since I want to use the [glfw](https://crates.io/crates/glfw) crate with the `glfw::ffi::glfwCreateWindowSurface` function. After creating the Surface with this function, I had no way to integrate it into the framework: creating a `vulkano::swapchain::Surface` object seemed out of the question because there is no public method/way to do it.

It's probably not the best solution. I'm open to better ones.

I propose it unsafe because it is very unsafe to use if you don't know what you are doing, I suppose.

Diff since 0.5.6: https://github.com/vulkano-rs/vulkano/compare/33deadd890c06641eda98cec380edf60b6427474...tomaka:7859ad69a685e86642e588c5895f0426ef958431

title: Remove the list of queue families in most places when creating a buffer or image
body:
Fix #577 

Makes the API much less cumbersome to use.

Obviously a breaking change. In theory we could deprecate existing functions and introduce new ones instead, but we'd run out of names pretty quickly if doing so.

title: Remove the call to vkDeviceWaitIdle in Device::drop
Add FixedSizeDescriptorSetsPool
body:
Close #512 

The `FixedSizeDescriptorSetsPool` is a better alternative to the `PersistentDescriptorSet` for when you want to change the bound resources at each frame. It preallocates descriptor sets and uses only the minimal amount of memory. Descriptor sets are then automatically reclaimed when no longer in use.

This PR contains a breaking change, which is that `DescriptorPool::alloc` now takes a `&mut self` instead of `&self`. The `DescriptorPool` trait is typically implemented on `Arc`s, so it shouldn't be much of a problem.

title: "Remove" the deprecated GraphicsPipelineParams
body: Changing the builder is more work than I anticipated, so in order to not block vulkano 0.6 on that let's just remove by turning `pub` into `pub(crate)`.

title: Finish implementing dedicated allocation
body:
Close #640 

Breaking change.

Modifies the API of `MemoryPool`. Its sole required method is renamed to `alloc_generic`, while `alloc` is turned into a provided method and takes an additional parameter which is the dedicated allocation.

`alloc` now also returns a `PotentialDedicatedAllocation<A>` instead of a `A`.

title: Support for VK_KHR_incremental_present
body:
The code should be pretty self-explanatory.

I'm unsure about the #[derive(Debug)] in vk_sys.

title: Fix wrong image dimensions being checked when copying from buffer
Add `resolve` to ordered_passes_renderpass!
body: To match the capabilities of Vulkan.

title: Fix CpuBufferPool capacity
body:
If you call `chunk()` with an empty iterator, the code will allocate a buffer of `iter_len * 3` elements, ie. 0 elements.

Then later when you called `chunk()` again with a non-empty iterator, the code will allocate a buffer of `iter_len * existing_capacity * 2` elements, ie. 0 again. Then it will detect that the buffer is still not large enough and enter an `unreachable!` code.

This fixes this problem.

title: Update Cargo.toml metadata
body: Reopening #716

title: Fix the image dimensions check being too strict
body: This bug unfortunately makes the `guide-*` examples panic.

title: Remove PipelineLayoutDescNames
body: Fix #631

title: Rework shader entry points
body:
The `[Vertex|Geometry|TessellationControl|TessellationEvaluation|Fragment]ShaderEntryPoint` structures have been merged into `GraphicsEntryPoint`.

In addition to this, building a graphics pipeline now has a signature that looks like:

```rust
fn foo(vertex_shader: Vs, ...)
    where Vs: GraphicsEntryPointAbstract
```

Compared to the current signature:
```rust
fn foo<'a, Vs, Vi, Vo, Vl>(vertex_shader: VertexShaderEntryPoint<'a, Vs, Vi, Vo, Vl>, ...)
    where: // ... tons of stuff ...
```

In other words the signature is greatly simplified.

The only downside is that for example passing a vertex shader instead of a fragment shader is now a runtime error instead of a compile-time error, but the benefits of this change greatly outweigh this drawback in my opinion.

body: Untested. Do not merge.
